column4: i need help getting my wireless card to see the available networks...can someone help me out?
Do you know if your wireless already configured?

if you are comfortable with using terminal, there guide I used is: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=684495. Though there might (probably) be more straightforward approaches, depending on your card
i'm not too comfortable.  i spent about 10 hrs last night and maybe 4 hrs tonight trying with no luck
i don't really know what i'm doing.  i tried following some procedures that i saw on some web pages, but i guess i didn't do it right
is this upgrade or new install?
You might want to check if your driver is supported (especially if it is a very new or exotic wireless card / board)
i tried the madwifi thing, but it didn't help.  i'm not sure how i missed that thread.  i'm on dual-boot, so i have to switch OSes.  i'll go give i another try.
i appreciate the help.  hopefully one of those will do the trick.
When I had issue, I found it VERY useful to get a second computer/laptop to surf while setting up wifi (or hoowing up an ethernet connection)
i have a desktop too, but it won't let any irc program connect to the servers for some reason
for now i just have to keep hopping back and forth, i guess
i'll be back in a little while..thanks again for the help.
